messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 744
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/28/2000 10:39:19 PM Central Daylight Time, ... I think that s a lot of it right there.  They re a bit suspicious and take a wait and see
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/28/2000 10:39:19 PM Central Daylight Time,
MorelFam@... writes:

> carron, this is great, funny, and very encouraging to see the switch! i
> think my dh is on his way there, but is watching as we go....
> erin
>

I think that's a lot of it right there. They're a bit suspicious and take a
wait and see attitude. First my dh needed to discover on his own that his
kids weren't going to be social and educational misfits. Only then could he
make the jump to hyperspace (aka unschooling).

Carron

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 744
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/26/00 4:56:23 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/26/00 4:56:23 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< I accused him of being

a pod person (a la Invasion of the Body Snatchers). This is the man who

three years ago told me that there would be no gaps in the education of his

children, that it would be my job to research all the available curriculum

packages, to choose the one that was the most rigorous and comprehensive, and

that cost was no object. Zack was 4, going on 5, at the time. >>

carron, this is great, funny, and very encouraging to see the switch! i
think my dh is on his way there, but is watching as we go....
erin
